newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft said creating WEB search engine.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft said creating WEB search engine.

text.p: Microsoft Corp is said to be developing its own Internet search engine/directory, Time Magazine said.

The magazine said in its Aug. 10 editions that the company should have a beta version ready by October, with a launch date of January 1998. It said the search engine is code-named Yukon and is most likely to be released directly on the World Wide Web and not restricted to Microsoft's MSN.

Time said, "Rumors of Bill Gates' foray into the Web's most popular genre have been floating around Silicon Valley for months, but until now no one knew whether he planned to buy an existing engine or create his own."
